Tools and resources

Components and patterns

Design patterns solve the common problems so teams can focus on the things unique to their service and it’s users.

Check the GOV.UK Design System to see if the component or pattern you need is already being used across government.

If you cannot find what you need in the GOV.UK Design System you can:

  • see if it is being worked on by other teams across government and add your findings
  • see if it is being worked on by someone in DfE and add your findings
  • propose a new pattern in the DfE backlog

  • propose a new pattern in the GOV.UK Design System. All patterns must be useful and unique.

  • Check other departments for design patterns and design resources

Wireframing

Open source kits are available for wireframing:

  • Google draw wireframing kit
  • Sketch wireframing kit
  • Balsamiq wireframing kit
  • Figma wireframing kit

User flows

Open source kits are available for producing flow diagrams:

  • Sketch flow kit
  • Google draw flow kit

Gov.uk Prototype kit

Use the Gov.uk Prototype kit to produce working prototypes.

Use the DfE GitHub account for version control and sharing code, to get a repo set up contact the UCD Operations team or your line manager.

To get an account you must set up two factor authentication.

All prototype repo’s must be named with an _proto and be managed by the design team.

  • View the design team prototype repositories on github
  • View the design team prototype repositories on the new design team github

Use Heroku for hosting your password protected prototypes.

  • Download the Gov.uk prototype kit
  • Converts Google Docs into Govspeak ready for Specialist Publisher

Gov.uk Prototype kit blog posts

  • Read tips on working with the Gov.uk prototype kit
  • More efficient prototyping with the GOV.UK prototype kit: step by step
  • Validation for prototypes

Training

The User-Centred Design Community provides a structure for designers, content designers and user researchers across government to learn from each other, collaborate and share best practice.

Upcoming GDS UCD training

Courses

  • Introduction to Design in Government
  • Getting started with the GOV.UK Prototype kit
  • Basic Introduction to User Research
  • Introduction to Service Design
  • Cross-gov design peer critique day
